info.title: Bosch IoT Manager API
info.description:
The Bosch IoT Manager REST API provides the full functionality of the service, including:

·    Retrieving devices and features; adding and modifying device-specific properties and attributes

·    A simple device registration mechanism

·    All grouping capabilities - listing, creating, modifying and deleting directories and tags

·    The complete mass management experience, which allows full control over tasks and rules


Find out more details in our [documentation](https://docs.bosch-iot-suite.com/manager/).

get.summary: Retrieve all available Rules
get.description: Retrieve all available Rules that satisfy the specified filtering criteria.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
An RQL filter over the Rule attributes.

The attribute names in the filtering conditions can be some of:
  • state - integer value corresponding to the Rule state as follows:
    0 - DEFINED
    1 - ENABLED
    2 - DISABLED
    3 - FAILED_TO_ENABLE
  • stateDescription - string value corresponding to the state description.
  • involvedCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of involved Devices in the Rule.
  • successCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of successfully finished Devices in the Rule.
  • warningCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of Devices finished with warning in the Rule.
  • errorCount - integer value corresponding the the number of Devices finished with error in the Rule.
  • cancelCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of Devices finished with warning in the Rule.
  • nextTimeTrigger - corresponds to the next trigger time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) if the Rule has a timer trigger.
  • ruleId - string value corresponding to the Rule id.
  • user - string value corresponding to the user name of the user that has created the Rule.
  • displayName - string value corresponding to the Rule display name.

    Filter operations:

  • eq({property},{value})
  • ne({property},{value})
  • gt({property},{value})
  • ge({property},{value})
  • lt({property},{value})
  • le({property},{value})
  • in({property},{value},{value},...)
  • like({property},{value})
  • exists({property})
    • Note: When using filter operations, only Rules with the specified properties are returned.

    Logical operations:

  • and({query},{query},...)
  • or({query},{query},...)
  • not({query})
    • Examples:
  • eq(state,0)
  • and(eq(involvedCount,2),eq(state,0))

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Possible values for the parameter:

Paging operations
  • size({page-size}) Maximum allowed page size is 200. Default page size is 25
  • cursor({cursor-id}) Start the search from the cursor location. Specify the cursor ID without quotation marks. Cursor IDs are given in search responses and mark the position after the last entry of the previous search. The meaning of cursor IDs is unspecified and may change without notice.

Examples:

  • size(10) return 10 results
  • cursor(LOREMIPSUM) return results after the position of the cursor LOREMIPSUM.

Combine:

If you need to specify multiple options, when using the swagger UI just write each option in a new line. When using the plain REST API programmatically, you will need to separate the options using a comma (,) character. size(200),cursor(LOREMIPSUM)

get.summary: Retrieve all Rules involving a particular Device
get.description:
Retrieve all Rules involving a particular Device in which the latter satisfies the applied state filter.

Available stateFilter values:

  • FINISHED_SUCCESS(0) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished with a success state
  • FINISHED_WARNING(1) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the execution with a warning state
  • FINISHED_ERROR(2) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the execution with an error state
  • FINISHED_CANCELED(3) : Retrieve only devices that have finished the execution with a canceled state
  • RUNNING(4) : Retrieve only Devices that have a running state
  • FINISHED(64): This value unites all FINISHED_xxx values and could be used only as a parameter for filtering
  • ANY(128): Retrieve all involved devices, regardless of the completion state

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all involved Devices
get.description:
Retrieve a list of all Devices which are involved in this Rule and satisfy the applied stateFilter. A Device is considered involved in the Rule if it is involved in at least one Task launched by that Rule.

Available stateFilter values:

  • FINISHED_SUCCESS(0) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished with a success state
  • FINISHED_WARNING(1) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the execution with a warning state
  • FINISHED_ERROR(2) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the execution with an error state
  • FINISHED_CANCELED(3) : Retrieve only devices that have finished the execution with a canceled state
  • RUNNING(4) : Retrieve only Devices that have a running state
  • FINISHED(64): This value unites all FINISHED_xxx values and could be used only as a parameter for filtering
  • ANY(128): Retrieve all involved devices, regardless of the completion state

get.summary: Retrieve all Tasks launched by the Rule
get.description: Retrieve all Tasks launched by the Rule. By default, only a limited amount of data is retrieved on a page with 20 elements.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
An RQL filter over the Task attributes.

The attribute names in the filtering conditions can be some of:
  • state - integer value corresponding to the Task state as follows:

    1 - RUNNING
    2 - FINISHED
    3 - FAILED_TO_LAUNCH
  • stateDescription - string value corresponding to the state description
  • involvedCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of involved Devices in the Task.
  • successCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of successfully finished Devices in the Task
  • warningCount - integer value corresponding the the number of Devices finished with warning in the Task
  • errorCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of Devices finished with error in the Task.
  • cancelCount - integer value corresponding to the the number of Devices finished with warning in the Task.
  • launchTime - long value corresponding to the Task launch time given as milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970
  • finishTime - long value corresponding to the Task finish time given as milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970
  • isPaused - boolean value that is true when the execution is paused due to time constraint restrictions
  • nextResume - corresponds to resume time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) if the Task is currently paused
  • nextPause - corresponds to the next pause time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) if the Task is currently not paused
  • taskId - string value corresponding to the Task id
  • ruleId - string value corresponding to the Rule id if the Task is launched by a Rule trigger
  • user -string value corresponding to the user name of the user that has launched the Task
  • action - string value corresponding to a textual representation of the searched action
  • displayName - string value corresponding the Task display name

    Filter operations:

  • eq({property},{value})
  • ne({property},{value})
  • gt({property},{value})
  • ge({property},{value})
  • lt({property},{value})
  • le({property},{value})
  • in({property},{value},{value},...)
  • like({property},{value})
  • exists({property})
    • Note: When using filter operations, only Tasks with the specified properties are returned.

    Logical operations:

  • and({query},{query},...)
  • or({query},{query},...)
  • not({query})
    • Examples:
  • eq(state,"0")
  • and(eq(involvedCount,2),eq(state,0))

get.summary: Retrieve all Tasks and respective execution status for a particular Device
get.description:
Retrieve all Tasks and respective execution status for a particular Device, which satisfies the applied state filter. The freeTasks value of true specifies that only Task executions not launched by any Rule should be retrieved, whereas the value of false specifies that all Task executions will be retrieved (including those launched by Rules).

Available stateFilter values:

  • FINISHED_SUCCESS(0) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the Task execution with a sucess state
  • FINISHED_WARNING(1) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the Task execution with a warning state
  • FINISHED_ERROR(2) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the Task execution with an error state
  • FINISHED_CANCELED(3) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the Task execution with a canceled state
  • RUNNING(4) : Retrieve only Devices that have finished the Task execution with a running state
  • FINISHED(64): This value unites all FINISHED_xxx values and could be used only as parameter for filtering
  • ANY(128): Retrieve all involved Devices, regardless of the completion sate

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Possible values for the parameter:

Paging operations
  • size({page-size}) Maximum allowed page size is 200. Default page size is 25
  • cursor({cursor-id}) Start the search from the cursor location. Specify the cursor ID without quotation marks. Cursor IDs are given in search responses and mark the position after the last entry of the previous search. The meaning of cursor IDs is unspecified and may change without notice.

Examples:

  • size(10) return 10 results
  • cursor(LOREMIPSUM) return results after the position of the cursor LOREMIPSUM.

Combine:

If you need to specify multiple options, when using the swagger UI just write each option in a new line. When using the plain REST API programmatically, you will need to separate the options using a comma (,) character. size(200),cursor(LOREMIPSUM)

get.summary: Retrieve all Devices
get.description: Retrieve a list of devices matching the given filter. Optionally, you can also use field.selectors (see parameter fields) to get only the specified fields.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filter operations:

  • eq({property},{value})
  • ne({property},{value})
  • gt({property},{value})
  • ge({property},{value})
  • lt({property},{value})
  • le({property},{value})
  • in({property},{value},{value},...)
  • like({property},{value})
  • exists({property})
    • Note: When using filter operations, only devices with the specified properties are returned. For example, the filter ne(attributes/owner, "SID123") will only return devices that do have the owner attribute.

    Logical operations:

  • and({query},{query},...)
  • or({query},{query},...)
  • not({query})
    • Examples:
  • eq(attributes/{attributeId},"value")
  • exists(features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}, value)
  • and(eq(attributes/{attributeId1},"value"),eq(attributes/{attributeId2},"value"))
    • Filters containing a wildcard * symbol at the beginning can slow down your search request.

parameters.name: namespaces
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of namespaces. This list is used to limit the query to things in the given namespaces only. If this parameter is omitted, all registered namespaces of your solution will be queried.

Examples:

  • ?namespaces=com.example.namespace
  • ?namespaces=com.example.namespace1,com.example.namespace2
  • ?fields=deviceId,attributes/location/longitude,attributes/address(city,street)

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Possible parameter values:

Sort operations
  • sort([+|-]{property})
  • sort([+|-]{property},[+|-]{property},...)

Paging operations
  • size({page-size}) Maximum allowed page size is 200. Default page size is 25.
  • cursor({cursor-id}) Start the search from the cursor location. Specify the cursor ID without quotation marks. Cursor IDs are given in search responses and mark the position after the last entry of the previous search. The meaning of cursor IDs is unspecified and may change without notice.

Examples:

  • sort(+id)
  • sort(-attributes/{attributePropertyValue})
  • size(10) return 10 results
  • cursor(LOREMIPSUM) return results after the position of the cursor LOREMIPSUM.

Combine:

If you need to specify multiple options, when using the swagger UI just write each option in a new line. When using the plain REST API programmatically, you will need to separate the options using a comma (,) character. size(200),cursor(LOREMIPSUM).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Contains a comma separated list of fields to be included in the returned JSON. Attributes can be selected in the same manner.

Selectable fields

  • ID
  • policyId
  • attributes

    Supports selecting arbitrary sub-fields by using a comma separated list:

    • several attribute paths can be passed as a comma separated list of JSON pointers (RFC-6901)

      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/{attributeValue} would select only attribute value (if present)
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue},attributes/{attributeId2}/{attributeValue}
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue1},attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue2}
    • a comma-separated list of sub-fields (a sub-field is a JSON pointer (RFC-6901) separated with /) to select
    • sub-selectors can be used to request only specific sub-fields by placing expressions in parentheses ( ) after a selected subfield
      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/(attributeValue1,attributeValue2)
  • features

    Supports selecting arbitrary fields in features similar to attributes

    features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

Examples:

  • ?fields=id,attributes,features
  • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}(attributeValue1,attributeValue1),features
  • ?fields=id,attributes/{attributeId1},features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

200.description: The existing and readable Devices are successfully retrieved. The filter supports a limit option, which if not specified explicitly returns a default count of 25 devices. Maximum list size is 200.

get.summary: Retrieve all Gateways
get.description: Retrieve a list of gateways matching the given filter. Optionally, you can also use field selectors (see parameter fields) to get only specified fields.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filter operations:

  • eq({property},{value})
  • ne({property},{value})
  • gt({property},{value})
  • ge({property},{value})
  • lt({property},{value})
  • le({property},{value})
  • in({property},{value},{value},...)
  • like({property},{value})
  • exists({property})
    • Note: When using filter operations, only devices with the specified properties are returned. For example, the filter ne(attributes/owner, "SID123") will only return devices that do have the owner attribute.

    Logical operations:

  • and({query},{query},...)
  • or({query},{query},...)
  • not({query})
    • Examples:
  • eq(attributes/{attributeId},"value")
  • exists(features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}, value)
  • and(eq(attributes/{attributeId1},"value"),eq(attributes/{attributeId2},"value"))
    • Filters containing a wildcard * symbol at the beginning can slow down your search request.

parameters.name: namespaces
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of namespaces. This list is used to limit the query to things in the given namespaces only. If this parameter is omitted, all registered namespaces of your solution will be queried.

Examples:

  • ?namespaces=com.example.namespace
  • ?namespaces=com.example.namespace1,com.example.namespace2
  • ?fields=deviceId,attributes/location/longitude,attributes/address(city,street)

parameters.name: option
parameters.description:
Possible parameter values:

Sort operations
  • sort([+|-]{property})
  • sort([+|-]{property},[+|-]{property},...)

Paging operations
  • size({page-size}) Maximum allowed page size is 200. Default page size is 25.
  • cursor({cursor-id}) Start the search from the cursor location. Specify the cursor ID without quotation marks. Cursor IDs are given in search responses and mark the position after the last entry of the previous search. The meaning of cursor IDs is unspecified and may change without notice.

Examples:

  • sort(+id)
  • sort(-attributes/{attributePropertyValue})
  • size(10) return 10 results
  • cursor(LOREMIPSUM) return results after the position of the cursor LOREMIPSUM.

Combine:

If you need to specify multiple options, when using the swagger UI just write each option in a new line. When using the plain REST API programmatically, you will need to separate the options using a comma (,) character. size(200),cursor(LOREMIPSUM).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Contains a comma separated list of fields to be included in the returned JSON. Attributes can be selected in the same manner.

Selectable fields

  • ID
  • policyId
  • attributes

    Supports selecting arbitrary sub-fields by using a comma separated list:

    • several attribute paths can be passed as a comma separated list of JSON pointers (RFC-6901)

      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/{attributeValue} would select only attribute value (if present)
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue},attributes/{attributeId2}/{attributeValue}
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue1},attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue2}
    • a comma-separated list of sub-fields (a sub-field is a JSON pointer (RFC-6901) separated with /) to select
    • sub-selectors can be used to request only specific sub-fields by placing expressions in parentheses ( ) after a selected subfield
      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/(attributeValue1,attributeValue2)
  • features

    Supports selecting arbitrary fields in features similar to attributes

    features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

Examples:

  • ?fields=id,attributes,features
  • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}(attributeValue1,attributeValue1),features
  • ?fields=id,attributes/{attributeId1},features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

200.description: The existing and readable Gateways are successfully retrieved. The filter supports a limit option and if not explicitly specified, a default count of 25 devices are returned. Maximum list size is 200.

400.description: The request could not be completed. The ID either does not contain the mandatory namespace prefix (java package notation + : colon) or does not conform to RFC-2396 (URI).

401.description: The request could not be completed due to missing authentication.

403.description: The request could not be completed due to missing authorization required for performing the requested operation on the given resource.

500.description: An internal error has occurred and the request could not be completed.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of Members
get.description: Retrieve a list of members(Gateways or Devices) that match the given filter.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the tag

parameters.name: devices
parameters.description: If the value is true, the members are devices, if it is false, the members are gateways.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Contains a comma separated list of fields to be included in the returned JSON. Attributes can be selected in the same manner.

Selectable fields

  • ID
  • policyId
  • attributes

    Supports selecting arbitrary sub-fields by using a comma separated list:

    • several attribute paths can be passed as a comma separated list of JSON pointers (RFC-6901)

      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/{attributeValue} would select only attribute value (if present)
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue},attributes/{attributeId2}/{attributeValue}
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue1},attributes/{attributeId1}/{attributeValue2}
    • a comma-separated list of sub-fields (a sub-field is a JSON pointer (RFC-6901) separated with /) to select
    • sub-selectors can be used to request only specific sub-fields by placing expressions in parentheses ( ) after a selected subfield
      For example:
      • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId}/(attributeValue1,attributeValue2)
  • features

    Supports selecting arbitrary fields in features similar to attributes

    features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

Examples:

  • ?fields=id,attributes,features
  • ?fields=attributes/{attributeId1}(attributeValue1,attributeValue1),features
  • ?fields=id,attributes/{attributeId1},features/{featureId}/properties/{category}/{propertyId}

actionType.description: The type of action used. All available action types can be listed through the method ws/mme/rules/actions

actionDef.description: A JSON object, which should satisfy the metadata required for this action type. The metadata for the given action type is available through the method ws/mme/rules/actions/{actionType}

ActionInfo.description: Groovy script and type defining the action for this Rule.

DeviceScopeInfo.description: The JSON Schema defines three pre-filled options in this order of priority - IdSelection, GroovySelection, GroupSelection - for defining Device Scope. Only one of them should be filled in. If several options are present - even if any of them is left empty or is invalid, all of them will be considered according to their order of priority.

overlapOption.description:
Defines whether multiple Tasks over the same device can overlap or should be replaced. This option is applicable only for Rules. Overlapping:
  • ALLOW_OVERLAPPING_TASKS(0): No relation constraint between Tasks. New Tasks can be triggered, although old Tasks are still active. This option should be used very carefully due to possible accumulation (explosion) of unfinished Tasks.
  • NO_OVERLAPPING_CANCEL_OLD(1) : In case of Rule firing for a particular device, any previous executions still running for this device in the scope of the same Rule will be canceled.
  • NO_OVERLAPPING_KEEP_OLD_SKIP_NEW(2): Skip triggering a new Task for devices that already have unfinished Tasks in the scope of the Rule.;

concurrencyLimit.description: Restricts the maximum number of devices concurrently executing a Task or Rule.

concurrencyTimeout.description: Timeout in seconds after which a non-confirmed execution expires and stops occupying room in the concurrency limit. The default value is 30 seconds.

oncePerDevice.description: If the Rule should be triggered no more than once for the same device, false otherwise

autoDisable.description: If the Rule should be automatically disabled once all targets from the Scope pass through the triggering conditions, false otherwise

timeConstraint.description:
A time schedule in which the Task execution is permitted. The time schedule constraint must be provided as a cron expression. Example:
  • * * 9-17 ? * MON-FRI: defines that the execution time will be on working days (Monday to Friday) between 9.00-17.00h
  • * * 00-01 * * ?: defines that execution time will be every day between 00-01 in the morning.
  • * * * 01 * ?: defines that execution time will be on the 1st day of each month .
